extracted_information: The web content provides comprehensive information about animation and motion accessibility, covering user considerations, technical implementation, and design patterns for inclusive motion design. It highlights issues like vestibular disorders, ADHD, and photosensitive epilepsy, offering solutions such as adhering to WCAG guidelines, utilizing media queries like `@prefers-reduced-motion`, providing user controls (pause/stop/hide toggles), and emphasizing progressive enhancement with reduced motion as a default.

WCAG_Flashing_Guidelines.flash_frequency: No more than three times in any one second
WCAG_Flashing_Guidelines.flash_threshold: Below the general flash and red flash threshold

specifications.WCAG_Motion_Guidelines_Threshold: Elements lasting more than five seconds, start automatically, and are part of other page elements require pause/stop/hide options for non-essential movement.

features.name: Photosensitive Epilepsy Analysis Tool (PEAT)
features.description: Free tool to identify if screen content, video, or animations are likely to cause seizures, especially for content with flashing or rapid transitions between light and dark colors.

features.name: User-controlled Pause, Stop, or Hide Mechanism
features.description: Mechanism (e.g., accessible JavaScript toggle) to allow users to turn off potentially problematic motion animation, either at the screen level or element level. Toggling 'motion off' can freeze all animations on the current and other screens.

features.name: @prefers-reduced-motion Media Query
features.description: CSS media query that checks the user's operating system settings related to animation, allowing developers to design sites that respect these preferences. Can be combined with other media queries like `@prefers-color-scheme` and `@prefers-contrast` for layered control.

features.name: Progressive Enhancement for Movement
features.description: Design pattern suggesting that if animation is unnecessary for understanding content, the default state should be the reduced motion version (i.e., animations off by default) unless users specifically ask for them.

photosensitivity_epilepsy_prevalence.demographics: more common in women and younger people

os_settings_naming.Windows: Show animations (on by default, must be turned off to reduce motion)
